old

Class OldMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • old.OldMain

  • public class OldMain
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to initialize and run the program. Upon initialization, this class loads properties files, sets the LookAndFeel of the GUI, initializes models, controllers, and other critical elements, and starts the GUI on the EventDispatchThread. When the program is finished, it saves any property changes so they are available for future runs.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Craig

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to begin running the StockMarket program.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments that may be passed to this program.

      • loadDefaultProperties

        private void loadDefaultProperties()
        Load the DefaultProperties for this program. The DefaultProperties are constant and never change, representing basic values this program depends on.

      • loadUserProperties

        private void loadUserProperties()
        Load the UserProperties for this program. The UserProperties are the properties that the user configures based on personal preference. They should be loaded every time this program is started.

      • saveProperties

        private void saveProperties()
        Saves the UserProperties file after the program has finished running. This allows any changes the user may have made to application properties at runtime to persist between program runs.

      • init

        private void init()
        Initializes models, controllers, and other critical elements the program will require.

      • initGUI

        private void initGUI()
        Initializes the program's GUI on the EventDispatchThread. Should only be invoked after all other program elements have been initialized.

      • setLookAndFeel

        private void setLookAndFeel()
        Set the LookAndFeel for the UIManager. Should be invoked prior to initializing the GUI.
